name: Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act

applicabilityChecks.description: HIPAA applies to covered entities and business associates

conditions.description: Healthcare providers who transmit health information electronically
Health plans including insurance companies and HMOs
Healthcare clearinghouses that process health information

rules.message: Uses and disclosures of PHI must be limited to minimum necessary to accomplish purpose
rules.remediation: Implement minimum necessary policies and procedures for all PHI uses and disclosures

rules.message: Uses and disclosures not permitted by Privacy Rule require individual authorization
rules.remediation: Obtain valid written authorization meeting all HIPAA requirements

rules.message: Psychotherapy notes require specific authorization separate from other PHI
rules.remediation: Implement separate authorization process for psychotherapy notes

rules.message: Marketing communications using PHI require specific authorization
rules.remediation: Obtain marketing-specific authorization before using PHI for promotional purposes

rules.message: Sale of PHI is generally prohibited with very limited exceptions
rules.remediation: Ensure PHI disclosures do not constitute prohibited sale

phiProcessingAnalysis.description: System analyzes PHI processing activities against HIPAA Privacy Rule requirements
validationProcess: Check lawful basis for each PHI use and disclosure
Check Notice of Privacy Practices compliance

assessmentQuestions.question: What type of entity is your organization?
choices: Health plan (insurance, HMO, employer health plan, etc.)
Business associate of a covered entity
Hybrid entity (both covered and non-covered functions)
assessmentQuestions.help: HIPAA applies to covered entities and their business associates

assessmentQuestions.question: Do you transmit health information electronically in connection with standard transactions?
assessmentQuestions.help: Standard transactions include claims, eligibility inquiries, referral authorizations, etc.

assessmentQuestions.question: Which covered entities do you provide services to?
assessmentQuestions.help: Business associates must have contracts with covered entities

assessmentQuestions.question: Approximately how many individuals' PHI do you handle annually?
assessmentQuestions.help: Volume affects some HIPAA requirements and breach notification thresholds

assessmentQuestions.question: What types of protected health information do you handle?
assessmentQuestions.help: Different types of PHI may have different protection requirements

assessmentQuestions.question: For what purposes do you use or disclose PHI?
assessmentQuestions.help: Different purposes have different HIPAA requirements

assessmentQuestions.question: Do you engage in marketing activities using PHI?
choices: Promotional gifts of nominal value only
We're not sure if our activities constitute marketing
assessmentQuestions.help: Marketing with PHI generally requires authorization

assessmentQuestions.question: Do you conduct or participate in research involving PHI?
assessmentQuestions.help: Research using PHI has specific authorization and IRB requirements

assessmentQuestions.question: What protections do you have for research involving PHI?
assessmentQuestions.help: Research requires specific HIPAA protections

assessmentQuestions.question: Do you have procedures for handling individual rights requests?
assessmentQuestions.help: HIPAA grants individuals specific rights regarding their PHI

assessmentQuestions.question: How long does it typically take to respond to access requests?
assessmentQuestions.help: HIPAA requires response within 30 days, extendable once by 30 days

assessmentQuestions.question: How do you implement the minimum necessary standard?
choices: Written policies identifying minimum necessary for routine uses
Role-based access controls limiting PHI access
Regular review and updating of access levels
We rely on professional judgment only
We haven't implemented minimum necessary procedures
assessmentQuestions.help: Minimum necessary is required for all PHI uses and disclosures except treatment

assessmentQuestions.question: Do you have business associate agreements (BAAs) with all entities that handle PHI on your behalf?
choices: Yes, all vendors have current BAAs
Most vendors have BAAs, some may be missing
Some vendors have BAAs, many may be missing
We don't have BAAs with vendors
We don't use outside vendors for PHI processing
assessmentQuestions.help: BAAs are required for all business associates handling PHI

assessmentQuestions.question: What requirements do your business associate agreements include?
choices: Permitted uses and disclosures of PHI
Prohibition on further use or disclosure
Return or destruction of PHI upon termination
assessmentQuestions.help: BAAs must include specific required provisions

assessmentQuestions.question: Do you have a current Notice of Privacy Practices?
choices: We have an old notice that needs revision
Not required for our entity type
assessmentQuestions.help: Most covered entities must provide Notice of Privacy Practices

assessmentQuestions.question: How do you distribute your Notice of Privacy Practices?
assessmentQuestions.help: Notice must be provided according to HIPAA requirements

assessmentQuestions.question: Do you have procedures for identifying and responding to breaches?
assessmentQuestions.help: HIPAA requires specific breach notification procedures

assessmentQuestions.question: What factors do you consider when assessing whether an incident is a breach?
choices: Nature and extent of PHI involved
Whether PHI was actually acquired or viewed
Extent to which risk has been mitigated
Whether incident meets safe harbor exceptions
We haven't had any incidents to assess
assessmentQuestions.help: Breach assessment requires considering specific risk factors

assessmentQuestions.question: What are your breach notification timeframes?
choices: Media notification within 60 days (if >500 in same area)
Business associate notification without unreasonable delay
We're not familiar with the timeframes
assessmentQuestions.help: Different breach types have different notification requirements

assessmentQuestions.question: Which administrative safeguards do you have in place?
assessmentQuestions.help: Administrative safeguards are required for PHI protection

assessmentQuestions.question: Which physical safeguards do you have in place?
assessmentQuestions.help: Physical safeguards protect PHI from unauthorized physical access

assessmentQuestions.question: Which technical safeguards do you have in place?
assessmentQuestions.help: Technical safeguards control electronic access to PHI

assessmentQuestions.question: What HIPAA training do you provide to workforce members?
choices: We don't provide formal HIPAA training
assessmentQuestions.help: Workforce training is required for all HIPAA covered entities

assessmentQuestions.question: Do you have a designated Privacy Officer?
choices: Yes, Privacy Officer with other duties
assessmentQuestions.help: Covered entities must designate a Privacy Officer

assessmentQuestions.question: How do you monitor HIPAA compliance?
choices: We don't have formal monitoring procedures
assessmentQuestions.help: Regular compliance monitoring helps identify and address issues

categories.name: Administrative Requirements
categories.description: Organizational and procedural requirements for HIPAA compliance

categories.name: Individual Rights
categories.description: Rights that must be provided to individuals regarding their PHI

categories.name: Uses and Disclosures
categories.description: Rules governing when PHI may be used or disclosed

categories.name: Business Associate Requirements
categories.description: Requirements for business associate relationships and agreements

categories.name: Breach Notification
categories.description: Requirements for breach assessment and notification

requirements.title: Privacy Officer designation
requirements.description: Covered entities must designate a Privacy Officer responsible for HIPAA compliance
requirements.details: A covered entity must designate a privacy officer who is responsible for the development and implementation of the policies and procedures required by the Privacy Rule.

complianceChecks.description: Designate qualified Privacy Officer with appropriate authority
Document Privacy Officer designation and responsibilities

requirements.title: Workforce training requirements
requirements.description: Covered entities must provide appropriate HIPAA training to workforce members
requirements.details: A covered entity must train all members of its workforce on the policies and procedures with respect to protected health information as necessary and appropriate for the members of the workforce to carry out their function within the covered entity.

complianceChecks.description: Provide initial and ongoing HIPAA training to all workforce members
Document training completion and maintain training records

requirements.title: Notice of Privacy Practices
requirements.description: Covered entities must provide individuals with Notice of Privacy Practices
requirements.details: A covered entity must provide a notice that is written in plain language and contains the elements required by the Privacy Rule.

complianceChecks.description: Create compliant Notice of Privacy Practices with all required elements
Provide notice to individuals as required by HIPAA

requirements.title: Right of access to PHI
requirements.description: Individuals have the right to inspect and obtain copies of their PHI
requirements.details: An individual has a right of access to inspect and obtain a copy of protected health information about the individual in a designated record set.

complianceChecks.description: Implement procedures for handling access requests within 30 days
Maintain systems capable of providing access to PHI

requirements.title: Right to request amendment
requirements.description: Individuals have the right to request amendment of their PHI
requirements.details: An individual has the right to have a covered entity amend protected health information or a record about the individual in a designated record set.

complianceChecks.description: Implement procedures for processing amendment requests within 60 days

requirements.title: Right to accounting of disclosures
requirements.description: Individuals have the right to receive an accounting of disclosures of their PHI
requirements.details: An individual has a right to receive an accounting of disclosures of protected health information made by a covered entity.

complianceChecks.description: Maintain disclosure tracking and provide accounting within 60 days
System to track and report disclosures

requirements.title: Right to request restrictions
requirements.description: Individuals have the right to request restrictions on uses and disclosures
requirements.details: An individual has the right to request that a covered entity restrict its uses or disclosures of protected health information to carry out treatment, payment, or health care operations.

complianceChecks.description: Implement procedures for considering and implementing restriction requests

requirements.title: Right to confidential communications
requirements.description: Individuals have the right to request confidential communications
requirements.details: An individual has the right to request and must be accommodated in reasonable requests to receive communications of protected health information from the covered entity by alternative means or at alternative locations.

complianceChecks.description: Accommodate reasonable requests for confidential communications

requirements.title: Minimum necessary standard
requirements.description: Uses and disclosures must be limited to minimum necessary to accomplish purpose
requirements.details: When using or disclosing protected health information or when requesting protected health information from another covered entity, a covered entity must make reasonable efforts to limit protected health information to the minimum necessary to accomplish the intended purpose of the use, disclosure, or request.

complianceChecks.description: Develop minimum necessary policies and procedures
Implement role-based access controls

requirements.title: Authorization requirements
requirements.description: Uses and disclosures not otherwise permitted require valid authorization
requirements.details: A covered entity may not use or disclose protected health information, except as permitted or required by the Privacy Rule or as authorized by a valid authorization.

complianceChecks.description: Obtain valid authorizations for uses and disclosures not otherwise permitted
Maintain authorization forms and tracking

requirements.title: Marketing restrictions
requirements.description: Marketing communications using PHI require authorization
requirements.details: A covered entity may not use or disclose protected health information for marketing purposes without a valid authorization, except for limited exceptions.

complianceChecks.description: Obtain marketing authorizations before using PHI for promotional purposes

requirements.title: Administrative safeguards
requirements.description: Implement administrative safeguards to protect PHI
requirements.details: A covered entity must implement administrative safeguards to protect the privacy of protected health information and to conduct the covered entity's health care business in accordance with the administrative requirements of the Privacy Rule.

complianceChecks.description: Implement required administrative safeguards including workforce training and access management
Document administrative safeguard policies and procedures

requirements.title: Physical safeguards
requirements.description: Implement physical safeguards to protect PHI
requirements.details: A covered entity must implement physical safeguards to protect the privacy of protected health information and to limit physical access to its facilities while ensuring that authorized access is allowed.

complianceChecks.description: Implement physical access controls and facility security measures
Establish workstation use and device control procedures

requirements.title: Technical safeguards
requirements.description: Implement technical safeguards to protect electronic PHI
requirements.details: A covered entity must implement technical safeguards to protect the privacy of protected health information and to control access to protected health information that is transmitted electronically.

complianceChecks.description: Implement access controls, audit logs, integrity controls, and transmission security
Establish user authentication and authorization procedures

requirements.title: Business associate agreements required
requirements.description: Covered entities must have business associate agreements with entities that handle PHI
requirements.details: A covered entity may disclose protected health information to a business associate and may allow a business associate to create, receive, maintain, or transmit protected health information on the covered entity's behalf only if the covered entity obtains satisfactory assurance that the business associate will appropriately safeguard the information.

complianceChecks.description: Execute compliant business associate agreements with all entities handling PHI
Monitor business associate compliance with agreement terms

requirements.title: Business associate compliance obligations
requirements.description: Business associates must comply with specified HIPAA requirements
requirements.details: A business associate must comply with the applicable requirements of the Privacy Rule with respect to protected health information.

complianceChecks.description: Implement HIPAA compliance program as business associate
Maintain policies and procedures for PHI protection

requirements.title: Breach assessment and determination
requirements.description: Entities must assess security incidents to determine if they constitute breaches
requirements.details: Following the discovery of a potential breach of protected health information, a covered entity or business associate must conduct a risk assessment to determine whether the incident constitutes a breach requiring notification.

complianceChecks.description: Implement procedures for breach assessment and risk evaluation
Document breach assessment methodology and decisions

requirements.title: Individual notification requirements
requirements.description: Individuals must be notified of breaches affecting their PHI
requirements.details: A covered entity shall notify each individual whose protected health information has been, or is reasonably believed by the covered entity to have been, accessed, acquired, used, or disclosed as a result of a breach.

complianceChecks.description: Provide individual breach notification within 60 days of discovery
Maintain records of breach notifications sent

requirements.title: HHS notification requirements
requirements.description: HHS must be notified of breaches meeting specified criteria
requirements.details: A covered entity shall notify the Secretary of HHS of breaches of protected health information in the manner and timeframe prescribed by the Privacy Rule.

complianceChecks.description: Report breaches to HHS within required timeframes (60 days for >500 individuals, annually for <500)

requirements.title: Media notification requirements
requirements.description: Media notification required for large breaches in same geographic area
requirements.details: A covered entity shall notify prominent media outlets serving a state or jurisdiction if a breach affects 500 or more residents of that state or jurisdiction.

complianceChecks.description: Provide media notification within 60 days for breaches affecting 500+ individuals in same area

documentRequirements.description: Notice of Privacy Practices explaining PHI uses, disclosures, and individual rights
requiredElements: Header stating this notice describes how medical information may be used and disclosed
Description of uses and disclosures for treatment, payment, and healthcare operations
Description of other permitted uses and disclosures
Description of uses and disclosures requiring authorization
Individual rights including access, amendment, accounting, restrictions, confidential communications, and complaints
Covered entity's duties including minimum necessary and safeguarding PHI
Procedures for exercising rights and filing complaints
Contact information for privacy officer or contact person
Effective date and revision information

documentRequirements.description: Agreements with business associates who handle PHI on behalf of covered entity
requiredElements: Permitted uses and disclosures of PHI by business associate
Prohibition on further use or disclosure except as permitted
Requirement to implement appropriate safeguards
Requirement to report breaches and security incidents
Requirement to ensure subcontractors comply with same restrictions
Individual rights assistance obligations
Return or destruction of PHI upon contract termination
Covered entity's right to terminate for cause

documentRequirements.description: Comprehensive privacy policies and procedures for HIPAA compliance
requiredElements: Policies for uses and disclosures of PHI
Minimum necessary policies and procedures
Individual rights procedures (access, amendment, accounting, restrictions, confidential communications)
Authorization policies and procedures
Workforce training procedures
Complaint procedures
Administrative, physical, and technical safeguards policies
Breach notification procedures

documentRequirements.description: Authorization forms for uses and disclosures requiring individual authorization
requiredElements: Description of PHI to be used or disclosed
Person or class of persons authorized to make use or disclosure
Person or class of persons to whom disclosure may be made
Purpose of use or disclosure
Expiration date or event
Individual's right to revoke authorization
Consequences of refusing to sign authorization
Potential for re-disclosure by recipient

documentRequirements.description: Procedures for breach assessment, notification, and response
requiredElements: Breach identification and assessment procedures
Risk assessment methodology for determining breach status
Individual notification procedures and timeframes
HHS reporting procedures and timeframes
Media notification procedures (if applicable)
Business associate notification requirements
Documentation and record-keeping requirements
Breach response team roles and responsibilities

checks.requirement: Notice of Privacy Practices exists and is current
checks.remediation: Create or update Notice of Privacy Practices with all required HIPAA elements including individual rights, uses and disclosures, and contact information

checks.requirement: Comprehensive privacy policies and procedures documented
checks.remediation: Develop comprehensive HIPAA privacy policies covering uses and disclosures, minimum necessary, individual rights, and administrative safeguards
Create or update authorization forms to include all required HIPAA elements
Designate qualified Privacy Officer with appropriate authority and responsibilities for HIPAA compliance oversight
Implement procedures for handling access (30 days), amendment (60 days), accounting (60 days), and restriction requests
Provide initial and ongoing HIPAA training to all workforce members with documentation and tracking
Develop and implement minimum necessary policies with role-based access controls and case-by-case review procedures

checks.requirement: Breach assessment and notification procedures operational
checks.remediation: Implement breach identification, assessment, and notification procedures meeting all HIPAA timeframes

checks.requirement: Business associate agreements in place with all vendors handling PHI
checks.remediation: Execute compliant business associate agreements with all entities that create, receive, maintain, or transmit PHI on behalf of covered entity

checks.requirement: Business associate agreements include all required provisions
checks.remediation: Update business associate agreements to include all required HIPAA provisions including safeguards, breach notification, and return/destruction requirements
Implement required administrative safeguards including information access management, workforce security, and assigned security responsibilities
Implement physical access controls, workstation use restrictions, and device/media controls
Implement access controls, audit controls, integrity protections, person/entity authentication, and transmission security

checks.requirement: PHI tracking and accounting systems operational
checks.remediation: Implement systems to track PHI disclosures and provide accounting to individuals upon request

tier_1.description: Individual did not know and by exercising reasonable diligence would not have known of violation

tier_2.description: Violation due to reasonable cause and not willful neglect

tier_3.description: Violation due to willful neglect but corrected within required time period

tier_4.description: Violation due to willful neglect and not corrected

enforcement_authority.state_attorneys_general: Limited enforcement authority for HITECH provisions

employment_records.description: Employment records held by covered entity in role as employer
employment_records.scope: Records related to employment, not healthcare

education_records.description: Records covered by Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA)
education_records.scope: Student health records maintained by educational institutions

de_identified_information.description: Information that does not identify an individual and for which there is no reasonable basis to believe can be used to identify an individual
de_identified_information.scope: Information meeting safe harbor or expert determination standards

limited_data_set.description: PHI with specified direct identifiers removed
limited_data_set.scope: May be used for research, public health, or healthcare operations with data use agreement

complaint_process.filing_deadline: 180 days from when complainant knew or should have known of violation
complaint_process.investigation_process: OCR investigates and may attempt informal resolution
complaint_process.resolution_agreement: Voluntary compliance through corrective action plan

compliance_reviews.description: OCR may initiate compliance reviews to assess HIPAA compliance
compliance_reviews.scope: Proactive reviews of covered entities and business associates

corrective_action.voluntary_compliance: Opportunity to demonstrate compliance or implement corrective action
corrective_action.civil_monetary_penalties: When voluntary compliance cannot be achieved

compliance_timeline.within_90_days: Notice of Privacy Practices updates, individual rights procedures
compliance_timeline.ongoing: Regular compliance monitoring and training updates
